ygData.subject: Re: How can I have elitism for each species?
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t understand why A,B,C should all be preserved, unless you can guarantee that all three will belong to different species.

I don't understand why A,B,C should all be preserved, unless you can guaran=
tee that all three will belong to different species.

hat I also set MutateSpeciesChampionProbability to 0.0.

t@yahoogroups.com, Jeff Clune <jeffclune@> wrote:
> >
> > Hello all-
> > 
>=
 > In Jason's HyperNEAT C++ code,  I am trying to enforce that the champion=
 of
> > each species is preserved.
> > 
> > I have a population size of 15 =
(small, I know) and a SpeciesSizeTarget of 3
> > (to have 5 orgs per specie=
s).
> > 
> > I set smallestSpeciesSizeWithElitism to 1.0 (so every species =
should have
> > elitism), and then I rate orgs like so
> > 
> > Org/Fitness=

> > 
> > A - 1000
> > B - 500
> > C - 500
> > All the rest 1
> > 
> > Pres=
umably A, B, and C should be preserved in the next generation, but that
> >=
 does not happen. I only get A.
> > 
> > I figured maybe elitism only appli=
ed to mutation and not crossover, so I set
> > MutateOnlyProbability to 1.0=
, but that did not solve the problem.
> > 
> > Any ideas?
